result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Samantha Humes as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $689.83 .
with attachments for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Samantha Humes in the amount of $689.83 .

Case called at 11:13am [mo]
Defendant Robert S Schmidt in court with attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, the Court strikes the Repeater Enhancer of Count #1.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 WITHOUT repeater enhancer; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court adopts the agreement of the parties.
On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening, per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for Sadie Starkey-Perschke and for treatment purposes per Agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay attorney fees


Days credit for time already served:  _0  days
recess:11:27am
Status conference on July 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2016 at 01:20 pm.

Case called at 2:03pm [mo]
Defendant Robert S Schmidt in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Schmidt. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Case called at 2:42pm [mo]
Defendant Robert S Schmidt in court.   DA Susan Hap appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
